intro: Liparis apiculata, commonly known as the apiculate orchid, is a species of orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is a terrestrial herb with a short, fleshy rhizome and a rosette of elliptic, dark green leaves. The plant produces a single inflorescence with several showy, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale pink. The flowers have three sepals and three petals, with the lateral petals being hooded and the lip being spurred. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
